citation.article-title: Lentibacillus salicampi gen. nov., sp. nov., a moderately halophilic bacterium isolated from a salt field in Korea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Lentibacillus (Len.ti.ba.cil'lus. L. adj. lentus slow; L. dim. n. bacillus small rod; N.L. masc. n. Lentibacillus slowly growing bacillus)
Spherical or oval endospores lie terminally in swollen sporangia.
Colonies are cream-coloured, smooth, circular to slightly irregular and raised on MA supplemented with 3.1% NaCl.
The cell wall peptidoglycan contains meso-DAP at position 3 of the peptide subunit.
The major fatty acids are anteiso-C15:0 and iso-C16:0.
The G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 44 mol% (determined by HPLC).
The type species is Lentibacillus salicampi.
